glossdef.para: DocBook is a system for writing structured documents using SGML and XML. This document is a DocBook document.
Technically it is the Federal Geographic Data Committee. The term more often refers to the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata (FGDC-STD-001-1998) in June 1998.

RedHat Package Manager. A software package distributed via this system is commonly referred to as an RPM. This system is used by many Linux distributions, including RedHat, Suse, Mandrake, and Yellowdog.
Standard Generalized Markup Language. XML is a subset of SGML. DocBook is typically written in SGML, although it can also be written in XML.
Extensible HyperText Markup Language. XHTML looks like HTML at first glance, but it is actually strict XML. No sloppy out-of-order tags are allowed.
XSL Transformations. These govern how an XML document can be transformed into another document.
